paper.title: Super-bits, Demi-bits, and NP/qpoly-natural Proofs
paper.venue: Randomization and Approximation Techniques in Computer Science
paper.abstract: We introduce the super-bit conjecture, which allows the development of a theory generalizing the notion of pseudorandomness so as to fool non-deterministic statistical tests. This new kind of pseudo-randomness rules out the existence of N P/poly-natural properties that can work against P/poly. This is an important extension of the original theory of P/poly-natural proofs [10]. We also introduce the closely related demi-bit conjecture which is more intuitive and is the source of interesting open problems.
